videos.title: Bailey's 25mm Wand Curls | Curly Hairstyles
videos.description:
Watch our new music video parody on MillennialMoms! Click HERE and laugh! http://youtu.be/RmPNillSGTI
-

Ever since I had cut my hair to shoulder length, I've been doing these wand curls. So many of you have been asking for a tutorial on how I create them, and they are really easy.

I section off my hair into three layers, bottom, middle, and top, and then use a 25mm curling wand, curling each strand "away" from my face. I hold the hair there for a few seconds, then release the wand and tug the hair strand a bit just to give the curl some length.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHWandCurls

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you think Brooklyn should do a DIY hairstyle soon!

üíã's -Bailey

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 25mm curling wand, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

___

videos.title: No-Heat Plopping Curls | Back-to-School Hairstyles
videos.description:
It has been a few months since our last no-heat curls tutorial, so we wanted to show you another one today that is perfect for Back to School!

These are called Plopping Curls {or Plunking Curls}, obviously because you plop your hair into a t-shirt, and then tie them up. I use a little product to help define the curls as they dry, so be sure to watch the video to get the full process.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHPloppingCurls

What I love about no-heat curl tutorials is that you are using absolutely zero heat in creating them. For this tutorial, it is a t-shirt creating the curls.

Be sure to start with your hair slightly more than damp, not "dripping" wet. If the hair is too wet, your curls will not turn out. As a reference point, be sure to notice how wet my hair is when I begin the plopping.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what hairstyle we should do next!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Damp hair, curl defining mousse, 1 t-shirt, dry shampoo, if desired.

Time Requirement: 2 minutes plopping & styling {not including overnight drying}

Skill Level: Easy

Clothing Links: All links to clothing worn in this video are on our website here... 
___

videos.title: Braided Half Up | Hairstyles for Prom
videos.description:
BONUS VIDEO! Be sure to check back here this coming Wednesday night, to see a bonus family video! It'll be a Room Tour of Daxton & Paisley's room! Paisley is so excited for you to see her new bed!

With Prom season right upon us, the girls and I wanted to give you an easy half-up hairstyle perfect for the dance. This is an updated variation of our Pancake Braids w/Sock Curls tutorial that we put up years ago {http://youtu.be/XUo47UiPh3Y}.

We began by curling Brooklyn's hair with a wand, and helping set the curls with hairspray. For the accents, you can use any type of braids you want, but I feel the best are Dutch Fishtails and 3-strand Dutch Braids. {This is because they pancake the best.} For this tutorial, and for the sake of time, we used Dutch Braids here.

The twins are not going to Prom this year, since they have chosen to not date until they are 16, but they are helping several of their upper classmate girls to do their hair for the night! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBraidedHalfUp

This would also make a wonderful Festival Hairstyle, something you could wear to Coachella or a medieval or renaissance fair. It pretty much looks great for any occasion!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you would like to see me post a Prom Prep & Texture tutorial!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 3 small hair elastics, 6-8 small bobby pins, finishing spray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 10-15 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=8596

videos.title: Boxer Braid No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
To try out the product I used in this video, please click HERE:
Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Curl Defining Gel Serum ‚Äì http://amzn.to/1TQmlsk

It's time for another no-heat curls tutorial! Today, we're happy to take part in Suave Professionals‚Äô ‚ÄúStyle It Yourself‚Äù program by teaching you how to get salon-quality curls at home using no heat! As a result, this tutorial will appear on Pinterest.com/SuaveBeauty!

This method is perfect if you are off to the gym in the morning, or running errands during the day, but have an event that you need to attend later that night. Two looks in one, which gives you a tight hairstyle for when you're active, and beautiful curls later on. I also use this method for overnight curls.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBoxerBraidCurls & #StyleItYourself

To get the look, all you need is damp hair, curl-defining serum gel, and Boxer Braids. The product helps condition my hair as a serum would, and also help define the curls like a gel would, but doesn't leave the hair feeling "crunchy" or stiff when I am done.

The Boxer Braid No-Heat Curls form in 3 Easy Steps:

1. Begin with damp hair, and add in the curl defining serum gel.
2. Create Boxer Braids {Double French Braids into a single braid} and allow to dry.
3. Remove the braids, finger comb the curls, and set your part line.

What I really love is that you can use these curls as a base for any number of hairstyle combinations {updos, buns, twists, French braids, Dutch braids, fishtail braids, pancake braids, accent braids, side braids, etc}. 

Please don‚Äôt forget to give this video a huge ‚ÄúThumbs Up‚Äù, and leave a comment below if you would like to see more curly hair tutorials!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hair elastic, Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Curl Defining Gel Serum, hairspray {optional}, silk scarf {optional to cover the hair if sleeping the the braids overnight}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=8483

__________

videos.title: DIY Faux Waterfall Headband | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Hey guys! We're super excited to announce that we'll be having a meet-up in Dallas/DFW Texas, at the P.S. from Aeropostale store in Grapevine Mills Mall, from 11am-1pm Saturday Feb 28th! Our whole family will be there, including BrooklynAndBailey, and we'd love, Love, LOVE to see you there!

If you aren't able to make it, you can always shop the P.S. looks we love - just go to http://www.ps4u.com and enter "CUTEGIRL" for 20% at checkout!
_______

This DIY Faux Waterfall Braid Headband is so easy to create, even a daddy can do it! It is also a perfect hairstyle if you are growing out your bangs! Since Bailey has to get ready so early in the morning, waking up at 4:45, she's become the master at quick and easy hairstyles, and this is one she loves!

This is one she's been wearing a lot lately, and takes literally 2 minutes to do! She also shares a few tricks to help keep the waterfall strands looking great!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHFauxWaterfall

Please be sure to give this video a HUGE "üëç" and leave comment below if we'll be seeing you at this week's Dallas/DFW meet-up!

üíã's -Mindy & Bailey

videos.title: How to Get Diffused Curls | Curly Hairstyles
videos.description:
To try out the product I used in this video, please click HERE:
Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Curl Defining Soft Touch Curls Mousse ‚Äì http://amzn.to/1qm6dHl

After receiving many requests from viewers on how I style my own natural hair, I am thrilled to take part in Suave Professionals‚Äô ‚ÄúStyle It Yourself‚Äù program by teaching you how to get salon-quality Diffused Curls at home! Yes, it is my secret weapon‚Ä¶ this has to be one of my most-requested tutorials ever!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDiffusedCurls & #StyleItYourself

To get the look, all you need is damp hair, curl-defining mousse, and a hair dryer {with diffuser}. The diffuser attachment slows down and disperses the air evenly from the dryer while its fingers gently separate the hair without blowing out your curl.

What I really love is that you can use these curls as a base for any number of hairstyle combinations {updos, buns, twists, French braids, Dutch braids, fishtail braids, pancake braids, accent braids, side braids, etc}. 

We are excited for our tutorial to appear on Pinterest.com/SuaveBeauty!

Please don‚Äôt forget to give this video a huge ‚ÄúThumbs Up‚Äù, and leave a comment below if you would like to see more curly hair tutorials!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Hair dryer, diffuser attachment, Suave Pro Curl Defining Mousse, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=8389

videos.title: Zombie Cheerleader | Hair Pin Curls | Halloween Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to watch BrooklynAndBailey's Last-Minute DIY Halloween Costume Ideas, and SUBSCRIBE to them!
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj0H71LavJZ9V5oKLkgddFwa1bvhdVvib

Can you help us get this video to 20,000 LIKES?
______________________________

Today's Hair Pin Curl tutorial was one we've been waiting nearly a year to show you. The curl type we use here isn't likely one you would use every day, but it is PERFECT for Halloween!!! üéÉ

We sure turned a lot of heads this weekend as we filmed the intro for this video! Bailey loved it, and really delved into character! {Shaun was pretty much embarrassed the entire time!}

You can use this technique as a base-texture hairstyle for a witch, lion, mad scientist, Bride of Frankenstein, zombie, Mad Hatter, etc!  Bailey wanted to be a Zombie Cheerleader! Pretty much anything that requires frizzy hair, even The Walking Dead!

Bailey's costume is from http://www.chasing-fireflies.com.

For this tutorial, I used hairpins to wrap the hair in a rick rack set {giving the resulting "rick rack" looking wave pattern, a classical sewing term}. I then secure the sets with bobby pins. This curling set isn't new, as it's been taught in styling schools for decades, and now several websites provide tutorials for them as well. {One of our favorites was done by the girls at thebeautydepartment.com.}

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHHairPinCurls

To get this look, be prepared to spend about an hour setting the hair {if you are doing this by yourself}. If you have a friend helping you, this process will go much faster.

To see the rest of our #CGHSpooktorials series, click here:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjtjdIDFVDBGJDzDn_f5uS-c

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 40-50 hair pins, 40-50 bobby pins or alligator clips, heat protectant, flat iron, hairspray, leaves and grass {optional}.

Time Requirement: 60 minutes

Skill Level: Hard {only because of time}

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

videos.title: How to Create "No-Heat" Paper Towel Curls
videos.description:
Want to see an adorable interview of Sweet Pea on BrooklynAndBailey's channel? Click here: http://youtu.be/h0tC1cGMMXw

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * 

You all know that we love posting no-heat curls tutorials from time to time! This one is inspired by a rag curls technique our grandmothers may have used when they were young. My own grandmother used to do them!

Rather than used a cut up t-shirt, we decided to use something just as effective, but something you would definitely have around the house... paper towels!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPaperTowelCurls

These work nicely, because they wick excess moisture from the hair to help hold the curl. My girls wear them to sleep, but for this video we filmed the before and after the same day, after about 5-6 hours at home. {If you want to expedite the process, you can choose a hairdryer on low heat.}

These curls are beautiful and voluminous. They are perfect as is, or as a base for a hairstyle combination with braids, buns, twist backs, etc. You can also get about 2-3 days worth of curls/waves by doing this!

Enjoy!

xoxo
Mindy


Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 roll of paper towels, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 30 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

videos.title: No-Heat Bandana Curls | Overnight Hairstyles
videos.description:
UPDATED MEETUP DATE:  We are holding our very 1st international "Meet & Greet" in Singapore on THURSDAY, January 23rd, 2014, from 5-7pm at the Atrium at *SCAPE! We hope to see as many of you from Singapore as possible, so please bring your friends... and meet some new ones! We will be giving away an autographed CGH t-shirt to the first 20 people there!

Tweet with us here... http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBandanaCurls

See more photos and written step-by-step instructions for this hairstyle at:
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=7094

Our No-Heat Curl video series {see them all here... http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL87EDA0AD6AAC4046} is very popular, and it's about time that we posted another no-heat tutorial!

This one uses nothing but a few bandanas/handkerchiefs, a few rubber bands, and a water spray bottle. This technique gives you more of a wave than a full curl, and it dries fairly well because the bandanas breathe by allowing moisture to evaporate as you sleep.

You can use these curls/waves as is, or you can incorporate them as a base for any number of hairstyle combos.  In this tutorial, Brooklyn simply added a simple headband as an accessory.

This is so easy, we know you all can do this! Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, spray bottle, 3-5 small hair elastics, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

videos.title: Cocoon Curls | Easy No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to check out Intermountain Moms on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/intermountainmoms/app_197602066931325

Nurse Dani at IntermountainMoms was able to help me this last week know when we should take CGH#1 to the doctor after she fractured her wrist during gymnastics... she saved me approx $150 for an x-ray that would have been too early to tell! {It is fractured, BTW. *sad*} They are also giving away a ton of stuff every day, so I, of course, entered the giveaway!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCocoonCurls

This week's hairstyle is sure to be a popular one, since so many women, moms, and teen girls are reluctant to use too much heat in their hair.  The challenge with no heat, is how do you obtain gorgeous curls without heat?

Well, we have already shown you how to create No-Heat Headband Curls:
http://youtu.be/0Rdfgu3zqY4

And we have shown you how to create No-Heat Sock Curls:
http://youtu.be/CzJKdHglFck

...but here we show you a very interesting, yet easy way to get voluminous curls without heat!  It uses a technique we call "Cocooning," yes, cocooning as in a caterpillar turning into a butterfly!  {We originally learned this curl from http://www.youtube.com/beautyklove, so be sure to check her out.}

This technique only provides the curl on the bottom half of the hair, so I find that a headband or hat is the perfect accessory for this hairstyle!  The curls also last for a few days, so you can combine these curls as a 2nd or 3rd day 'do using any of our accent braids, twists, etc!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, bandana, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 15-20 minutes

To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

Want to become a "Super Fan" of the week, and potentially have your photo appear in a future video?  Simply email us a photo of you doing something crazy or fun while wearing a CGH t-shirt!  Grab our gear here...

http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.bigcartel.com

...and follow us at our other social hangouts!

videos.title: Sock Curls | Easy No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

...and follow us at our other social hangouts!
http://www.bloglovin.com/blog/1815559
http://www.facebook.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles
http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair
http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

We have had lots of fun lately trying out several curling options that use absolutely no heat!  Many of you have already seen our tutorial for "No-Heat Headband Curls here... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Rdfgu3zqY4

Instead of using a headband on this one, we used simple socks!  This is super easy to do, and the curls last a long time. I also like pin curls or rag/paper bag curls but they can take up to 20-30 minutes or more to put in.  This takes literally 2 minutes to put in, and you can style the hairdo the next day in any number of combinations!

I tied in the socks lower, because we are totally into the low curls lately... but you could roll them all the way up for more volumous curls up top.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHSockCurls

It is key to make sure that the hair is slightly damp {not wet} anytime you want no-heat curls. If the hair is too wet, it will not hold the curl as well.

Aren't these ho-heat curl hairstyles so fun?  Enjoy!
